thread.title: HESPERIA: Residents warned about mountain lion seen roaming the city
thread.title_full: HESPERIA: Residents warned about mountain lion seen roaming the city - Press Enterprise

author: BRIAN ROKOS
title: HESPERIA: Residents warned about mountain lion seen roaming the city
text:
BY BRIAN ROKOS / STAFF WRITER
 Updated: 10:33 a.m. HESPERIA: Residents warned about mountain lion seen roaming the city Print Photo Share Pin It More Galleries ADVERTISEMENT A mountain lion climbed up a 35-foot-high wooden power pole Tuesday afternoon, Sept. 29, on East End Road about two miles south of Cougar Buttes in Lucerne Valley. Residents of nearby Hesperia were warned the same day about a mountain lion roaming that city's streets. COURTESY OF VICTORVILLE DAILY PRESS Related article Â» If you see the mountain lion Anyone who sees a mountain lion in Hesperia should call that city's animal control department at 760-947-1707.
Residents of the High Desert city of Hesperia were warned this week after a mountain lion was seen roaming in the area of Arrowhead Lake Road.
It's unclear whether the cat was the same seen atop a power pole in nearby Lucerne Valley on Tuesday.
Mountain lions looking for food and water can enter yards of homes, a notice on the city's website said .
Residents were warned to keep small pets indoors, remove open water and food and not to make contact with a mountain lion.
Anyone who sees a mountain lion in Hesperia should call that city's animal control department at 760-947-1707.
